title: Compute z-statistic for mean exam section scores

content.prompt: Which of the following is the test statistic for the appropriate test to determine if there is a significant mean difference between the percent correct on the two sections (first minus second) for all candidates similar to those in the investigation?

choices.label: t= 75−65 8 50 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ED2@

t= 75−65 10 2 50 + 5 2 50 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWG0bGaeyypa0ZaaSaaa8aabaWdbiaaiEdacaaI1aGaeyOeI0Ia aGOnaiaaiwdaa8aabaWdbmaakaaapaqaa8qadaWcaaWdaeaapeGaaG ymaiaaicdapaWaaWbaaSqabeaapeGaaGOmaaaaaOWdaeaapeGaaGyn aiaaicdaaaGaey4kaSYaaSaaa8aabaWdbiaaiwdapaWaaWbaaSqabe aapeGaaGOmaaaaaOWdaeaapeGaaGynaiaaicdaaaaaleqaaaaaaaa@454D@

topic.text: 7.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
